instruction: What metric was chosen to measure the accuracy to model, map, and analyze the biomass change of mangrove forests in the Cangio region in Vietnam between 2000 and 2011 and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to measure the accuracy of the biomass mapping in the related research was the coefficient of determination (R-adj(2)). This metric measures the proportion of the variance in the biomass data that can be explained by the model. 

The R-adj(2) value can range from 0 to 1, with a higher value indicating a better fit of the model to the data. In this study, the highest accuracy achieved was an R-adj(2) value of 0.73, which suggests that approximately 73% of the variance in the biomass data could be explained by the model. 

It is important to note that the R-adj(2) value provides a measure of the goodness of fit of the model within the specific study area and time period. The accuracy of the biomass mapping may vary when applied to different regions or time periods. Therefore, the extent to which this metric can go depends on the specific context and conditions of the study.
